forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Drizzle then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle between 10pm and 4am, then a chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind 5 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Veterans Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4pm, then a slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The evening in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under a canopy of mostly cloudy skies, with a whisper of drizzle shyly teasing the streets. As the temperature hovers around 54 degrees, a gentle south wind imparts a coolness that invites a cozy sweater or a light jacket. Later, as night deepens, the chance of rain transforms from mere possibility to likelihood, scattering droplets that may linger into the early morning, barely measurable yet softening the edges of the bustling city.

Looking ahead to Veterans Day, the promise of rain looms more substantial, particularly before the afternoon respite. Temperatures are anticipated to wane slightly, sliding down to a mild 56 degrees, while the west-southwest winds usher in gusts that can flirt with 28 mph. Those venturing into the urban tapestry may find the landscape draped in a light veil, as the marine layer creeps in, coaxing the fog that often cloaks the Golden Gate Bridge. This is a day to embrace the indoor comforts of a local café, perhaps with a book in hand, or to enjoy a leisurely stroll under the shelter of an umbrella, finding beauty in the gentle rhythms of a city kissed by rain.
